description: {"blocks":[{"key":"hqt","text":"Formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded (FFPE) samples are valuable but under-utilised in single-cell omics research due to their low DNA and RNA quality. Leveraging recent single-cell genomic technology advances, we introduce snPATHO-seq: a versatile method to derive high-quality single-nucleus transcriptomic data from FFPE samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

groups.title: Human Cell Atlas Method Development Community
Single Cell Core, Harvard Medical School

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4sm2n","text":"Cut 1 or 2 approximately 25 μm-thick sections (punches are also possible) and transfer to a 1.5 mL Eppendorf tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c9vt9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"coka6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"40cgr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"37ufa","text":"Store dry at 4°C if not used immediately. To keep it dry store in a container with silica beads. You can use the cylinder with silica beads that comes with 10x Genomics chips.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f74d1","text":"Digest tissue for 45-60 mins(*) at 37°C in a Thermomixer at 800 RPM.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3546e","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3419i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"s14","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3qaco","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"shaker","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":2700,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"in Thermomixer","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"shaker":false,"temperature":false},"shaker":"800","start":null,"temperature":"37","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"djga4","text":"(*) Some blocks require longer digestion time. Inspect visually and help dissociation by pipetting up and down with a P1000 pipette.","type":"align-left"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2e0h2","text":"","type":"align-left"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"f9pe4","text":"IMPORTANT: Dissociation does not need to be complete; the objective here is to loosen up the material to facilitate the nuclei release. Dissociation completeness varies from block to block. Tissue does not need to be fully digested.","type":"align-left"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1btmo","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

Solution","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"RPMI1640","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"0.25-1","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"Liberase Solution","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"7":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3frvk","text":" (*) Liberase TH is very good enzyme too and can be used alone at 1-2.5 mg/mL.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"37a2q","text":"(**) Collagenase P (Roche) works fine as well.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9p1tk","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":11,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"5f4b6","text":"IMPORTANT: I strongly recommend testing what concentration of enzymes works best for your tissue of interest. In our experience, Liberase TH alone at 1 mg/mL or the trio at 1 mg/mL Liberase TM + 1 mg/mL Collagenase D + 0.5 mg/mL Hyaluronidase works well with most of the samples we tested. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6qfp4","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":7,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"eb564","text":"Pro tip: Add 200 μL of the enzymatic cocktail and mince using a pestle for at least 10 strokes, then complete to 1 mL with the rest of the cocktail mix. ","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"apniv","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":16,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"89j9","text":"Optional Pro tip: Before digestion, add 100 μL of digestion mix and homogenize the sample using a douncer/pestle by stroking 10-20 times. This helps in the digestion step. Then top up with the rest of the digestion mix. ","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

For nuclei derived from FFPE blocks, we typically use 1-2 additional cycles during indexing to start with. If the library does not reach the recommended range but the Bionalyzer/Fragment Analyzer/Tapestation traces look as expected (single peak at ~265 bp), then do not add additional cycles. If you see signs of under/over amplification in the traces, then adjust cycling accordingly. ","type":"align-left"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
